Belgium: The Saint-Joseph reaches its home port of Ostend from a voyage to Canton.
Brazil: Filipe dos Santos Revolt, also known as the Vila Rica Revolt.
The Capitania de Minas Gerais (Captaincy of Minas Gerais) is established, after being separated from the Captaincy of São Paulo and Minas de Ouro.
China: Chinese expedition to Tibet: A Qing expedition expelled the invading forces of the Dzungar Khanate from Tibet.
France: Treaty of The Hague: France and its allies signed a treaty with Spain, thus ending the War of the Quadruple Alliance.
India: Bajirao I appointed by Shahu Maharaj as Peshwa(prime minister) who later will expand the Maratha empire .
Japan: The foreign books restrictions are reduced, starting a Rangaku practice.
Sweden: The Treaty of Frederiksborg is signed, requiring Sweden to cede Schleswig to Denmark-Norway.
